english_translation: Narrated by al-Mughirah ibn Shu'bah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ went to answer a need during the expedition of Tabuk. Al-Mughirah said: I went with him carrying water. When the Messenger of Allah ﷺ came, I poured the water upon him. He washed his face, then attempted to draw his hands from the sleeves of his tunic but could not due to the narrowness of the sleeves, so he drew them from beneath the tunic and washed his hands, wiped his head, and wiped upon the khuffs (leather socks). Then the Messenger of Allah ﷺ came while Abd al-Rahman ibn Awf was leading them, and he had already led them in one rak'ah. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ then led them in the remaining rak'ah, at which the people became alarmed. When the Messenger of Allah ﷺ finished, he said: You have done well.

english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Umar: When he came to Kufa upon Sa'd ibn Abi Waqqas who was its governor, he saw Abdullah ibn Umar wiping upon the khuffs. He disapproved of that, so Sa'd said to him: Ask your father when you come to him. Abdullah came and forgot to ask Umar about it until Sa'd came. He said: Did you ask your father? He said: No. So Abdullah asked him. Umar said: When you put your feet into the khuffs and they are pure from wudu, then wipe upon them. Abdullah said: Even if one of us comes from the toilet? Umar said: Yes, even if one of you comes from the toilet. And separately: Abdullah ibn Umar used to urinate in the marketplace, then perform wudu, washing his face and hands, and wiping his head. Then when he entered the mosque for a funeral prayer, he wiped upon his khuffs and prayed. Also narrated: I saw Anas ibn Malik go to Quba, urinate, then perform wudu, washing his face, his hands to the elbows, wiping his head, and wiping on the khuffs, then he came to the mosque and prayed.

english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Umar: Whenever he had a nosebleed, he would turn away and perform wudu, then return and continue his prayer without speaking. And it reached Malik that Abdullah ibn Abbas used to have a nosebleed and would go out and wash the blood from himself, then return and continue his prayer. Additionally: Yazid ibn Abdullah ibn Qusayt al-Laythi saw Sa'id ibn al-Musayyab have a nosebleed while he was praying, so he went to the chamber of Umm Salamah, the wife of the Prophet ﷺ. He was brought water and performed wudu, then returned and continued his prayer.

Topics: Chapter heading on wudu from madhy

english_translation: Narrated by al-Miqdad ibn al-Aswad: Ali ibn Abi Talib ordered him to ask the Messenger of Allah ﷺ about a man when he comes close to his wife and madhy (pre-ejaculate) comes out from him, what is his obligation? Ali said: Indeed I have the daughter of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, and I am shy to ask him. Al-Miqdad said: So I asked the Messenger of Allah ﷺ about that, and he said: If one of you finds that, let him sprinkle his genitals with water, and let him perform wudu as he performs wudu for prayer. And separately: Umar ibn al-Khattab said: Indeed I find it descending from me like the khariza (thin thread), so if one of you finds that, let him wash his penis, and let him perform wudu as he performs wudu for prayer, meaning the madhy.

english_translation: Chapter: On the Practice (Method) of Ghusl from Janabah
Topics: Chapter heading on method of ritual bath from janabah

english_translation: Narrated by Aisha, Mother of the Believers: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ when he performed ghusl from janabah, began by washing his hands, then performed wudu as he performed wudu for prayer, then he put his fingers in water and loosened the roots of his hair, then poured water upon his head three times with his hands, then poured water upon his entire body. And separately: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ would perform ghusl from a container which is the faraq (specific measure) from janabah. And separately: When Abdullah ibn Umar performed ghusl from janabah, he would pour water on his right hand first and wash it, then wash his genitals, then rinse his mouth and nose, then wash his face and splash water in his eyes, then wash his right hand then his left hand, then wash his head, then perform ghusl, and pour water upon himself.
